Test: I don’t want to sleep yet.
I don’t want to sleep yet.
I don’t want to sleep yet.
I don’t want to sleep yet.

I’m tired…
but it’s too early.
I don’t want to sleep yet.
I don’t want to sleep yet.

It’s hard, but I need
to at least try...

I feel… off.
Maybe just tired.

Sleep didn’t help.
I just need to start moving.
Feels like this body isn’t mine.

Wish I could just
get some real sleep.
Can’t get it out of my head.

Please,
just make it all stop.

Got a bit more energy
after the run.

It was hard,
but I’m not giving up.

Feels like I’m not
in shape anymore.

People say “Stay strong”.
So you hang in there too, huh.

“Stay strong”?
What the hell am I supposed
to stay strong for?

Feels like we’re
both falling apart.

Feels like we’re
both falling apart.

I don’t feel anything.
Not hunger.
Not taste.

I don’t feel anything.
Not hunger.
Not taste.
Is this supposed to be a joke?
I can’t get it out of my head...
Well, I did everything I could.

“Stay strong”?
What does that even mean?!

What does it say?
I can’t tell.

I remember us singing
in the kitchen, the four of us…

We even talked about
playing on a stage someday...

Haven’t played in a while.
Should probably tune it sometime.

We used to drag it to the lake:
campfire, wet sand,
strings smelling of smoke...

Now it’s just deadlines
and doctor’s visits.
The fires live in photos.

I can’t even remember
where A minor goes.

My fingers shake,
and my head’s full
of test results.

The guitar’s in the corner.
I’m not touching it.
Not now.

Don’t even want to replace it.
Let it stay off.

The strings ring too loud.
It’s irritating.

I want it to sound again.
But I can’t.

It’s dusty.
Feels like it’s not mine anymore.

The guitar doesn’t recognize me.
And I don’t recognize it.

Noise in my head
drowns everything.

Too heavy.
Even my eyes slide past it.

I suddenly decided
I was going to paint…

I bought brushes, canvases,
and even brought an easel
from the village...
And never finished a single one.

Every time I’d say:
“I’ll start painting as soon
as I wrap up this project”…

The canvases just sit there.
Waiting, same as me.

One day I picked up a brush
and just stared at the canvas…

No image, no spark.
Only a low hum in my head…

Set the brush down.
Didn’t even pour out the water.

These canvases weigh
on me like open loops…

What was I even trying
to say with them?

Shoved the whole stack
into a corner.
Kept bumping into it, got angry…

Wanted to throw it all out,
but my hand wouldn’t move…

They just get in the way.
Like so much else.

Too much emptiness.
Inside me, on the canvas…
Too late to finish anything now…
No one’s going to see it anyway.

I was always dragging books
home from sales
for “inspiration”…

Sometimes I’d read at night,
mark passages,
scribble in the margins…

I should at least finish
one someday.

The bookmark’s still
on the same page...

What was it even about?
I forgot.

The books stare at me.
Judging.

My brain refuses
to absorb the text.
I can’t hold a single thought.

Just meaningless words,
wrapped in paper.

What could they tell me
that I’m not already feeling?

Maybe I should throw them out.
Make space.

It all presses down
like someone else’s expectations...

I don’t think I can
even read the titles anymore.

Finishing them
won’t make me stronger.

The books are gone.
Just empty rectangles now.

I wanted to learn knitting,
but I never had the patience.

Someday I’ll make a scarf.
Maybe for me.
Maybe for someone else.

The colors feel so warm.
Nice to touch.

There’s always something else.
No time for yarn.

I started a couple times.
Then gave up.
They tangle just like my thoughts.

The hook’s broken.
I didn’t even notice when.

I can’t focus.
Every stitch feels like a task.

I’m not even angry.
Just watching it fade away...

Why is it so hard
to let go of useless things?

Fine motor skills
are the enemy now.

Everything in this basket
is a frozen “what never was.”

I love the morning light.
Everything feels possible.

Even the birds sound
like they’re whispering.

It’s sunny… but strange.
Like it’s on delay.

Today was supposed
to be a good day.
Maybe.

People move forward.
I feel like I’m not allowed.

The world outside
looks out of focus.

Rain noise makes
it hard to think.

Puddles reflect the ceiling.
Can’t even see the sky.

Everything’s gone gray.
Even the trees.

Just water and glass.
That’s all.

The world’s losing it.
And I’m just…
left behind.

I can’t see anything.
Not even myself in the reflection.
